title: [K-12] Social Science Competency Enhancement Program Through Video-Based Reasoning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational social science concepts and ability to utilize digital devices
context.additional_context: Learners acquire reasoning skills for analyzing social phenomena and deepen contextual understanding through video content-based projects

learning_goals: Learners must analyze three video materials on social issues (e.g., environmental pollution, youth problems), identify at least five explicit pieces of information and two implicit messages, and synthesize them into a logical reasoning report of three or more sentences.
Enhance the ability to apply three or more reasoning types (cause-effect, prediction, evaluation) through video-based interactive activities

In a PBL (Problem-Based Learning) environment, learners must visualize social phenomenon analysis results as one infographic or a two-page report and score 3+ points (out of 5) on a teacher evaluation rubric (organization, accuracy, creativity).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
